website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight all-aluminum saltwater reel travels well and performs alongside the big brands.
pros: Smooth reel action and steady drag, with a manual bail that allows for pinpoint control when fighting fish
cons: Hand crank seems a little flimsy
Reel mechanism may stiffen or catch over time

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a solid reel
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Caught multiple Sailfish, wahoo, blackfin tuna and Mahi on these slick reels. Fast retrieve, solid construction and good looks for a Benjamin? I bought 8 for my charter boat and haven’t been disappointed yet. Update: I purchased 8 bg6500 and 4 bg4500 reels Nov 2016 and have absolutely thrown everything at them. Good: Drag system, infinite anti reverse, metal construction. Bad: bail roller corrodes easily, getting seized in the process. Costs $25 to replace...
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best spinning reel I have owned -
customer_reviews.text: I live in south FL on the water and fish year round - I started looking for new reels, when my brand new Penn Fierce 2 8000 series reel had drag issues while fighting a nice shark. The drag on this 8000 BG is twice as smooth, and doesn't bind up like the Penn Fierce 2 drag. Ive already caught 2 nice sharks (5-6ft) on this BG with no issues, and the drag was extremely smooth.
customer_reviews.author: boknows

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for a awesome price feel great in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great reel for a awesome price feel great in the hand I match it up with ugly stick gx 2 and some kast king braid .
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, lot of reel for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Loaded with 30# braid and spent a week casting for stripers. Very happy, smooth action, bail is closed manually (one of the reasons I wanted it) so heavy baits do not snap the action closed and break you off. Better than my old black and gold and my 704's and 750SS's. Fast retrieve with a solid drag. I am sure this reel will pass the test of time with proper care. Well time to get back to fishing.....................
customer_reviews.author: Chris/Marion

customer_reviews.title: I can flat out say that this reel is much better than the Battle and loses nothing against the Stradic
customer_reviews.text: I waited several months to put a review up for this reel. Right now I have a Daiwa BG, a Penn Battle II, Penn Fierce II, a few Shimano Siennas and some other odds and ends. I've also fished with some Stradics as well. I can flat out say that this reel is much better than the Battle and loses nothing against the Stradic. This reel hits the sweet spot as far as quality. If you want to get a solid quality reel with everything you need and nothing you don't, this is it for the right price. Any higher than this and you start getting into diminishing returns and features that may not translate to anything useful.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This reel is built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: This reel is built like a tank! I got the 8000 series and I put 400 yards of reaction tackle 80lb braid on it and it casts very well. It is a bit heavy in hand indeed but the quality and size you get with this reel is completely unmatched at this class of reel. No Penn or shimano will come close to the spool size or drag pressure this has in the 100 dollar price range. Some 500 dollar reels don't perform this well. I'm a sold Daiwa customer with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Cappelli

customer_reviews.title: BEAST on a budget
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Hands down the best reel I ever purchased under $100. Daiwa could have easily priced this thing double and it still would be a bargain. Cranked a couple of 15+lb ling cod and a 20+lb wsb so far and it hasn't even flinched I'm ready for a real test when the tuna come around. My only quip is that it's a bit heavy to hold for an extended period of time but hey maybe I need to work out. Loaded it with kastking 80lb at first and kastking did NOT live up to it's name. Reloaded with 80lb Daiwa j-braid x8 and now it's smooth as eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Daiwa 8000 is a tank!
customer_reviews.text: I have the 8000 and man it is a nice reel. Reels smoothly and the drag is strong. Was able to pull in a 80lb plus blue fin tuna no problem. Paired this up with the daiwa saltist rod extra heavy. If you’re thinking about using this for tuna don't think twice and get it. Its a great 100 real and a little heavy but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: Got this reel as a birthday present for my gf, coming up on a year and, the gf is now my fiancé. I bought this reel as a first for her, expected it to get banged around like any tyro angler will do. It preformed flawlessly, great line lay and durability. It was tested on numerous stripers and bluefish. Bulldogging Tautog, Black seabass and scup. One cannot stress enough the durability and value of this reel! I’m getting one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Weeden

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Daiwa BG 6500 and spooled with 40 lb. braid. Paired with Penn Heavy Spinning Rod and it's exactly what I had been looking for. Reel is excellent quality and smooth action and line lay to reel is perfect. Once again Daiwa has come through with a excellent product which only those who want to spend hundreds more on a reel can complain about, and then it's probably ego and not product quality. Thanks, Daiwa and Amazon for a job well done.
customer_reviews.author: STATSRT

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Code-  #staybreezyfam Daiwa's first spinning reel rolled off the assembly line in 1955. Since then, the company has grown into one of the largest and most influential tackle companies in the world today. From the very beginning, Daiwa's emphasis has been upon innovation and quality. The result is a long list of product features, design and materials that have become standards for the fishing tackle industry. #Daiwa #GoPro #LifeStyle #bullbuster #power #outdoors #vlog #youtube #tuna #wahoo #kingfish #world #creative #video #videography #breezelifefishing #saltwaterworld #family #amazondeals #mahimahi #kayak #fish #trolling #amazon #best #outdoors #fishing
customer_reviews.author: Prentice Pullins (Breeze Life Fishing)

customer_reviews.title: Daiwa fanboy for life
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Daiwa reels for over 25 years and they just seem to hold up better than anything else. I have old version BG reel from the 90’s that was used twice a week in the Gulf of Mexico groupers and snapper fishing. The thing still goes strong on my surf rod for Reds on the Carolina outer banks. For the price you just can’t beat the BG reels. Quality, smooth, cost effective and built like tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nye

customer_reviews.title: Strong reel
customer_reviews.text: Durability? Ask me that after crab season. This is the new reel I have been shopping for. I found it on Amazon at a good price, cheaper then most dealers. It only took two days to grt to my door? I didn't request special shipping, it's my Xmas gift. My main use of a spinning reel is crab snare fishing. It's hard on reels and the Daiwa 5000 holds up! The manual bail helps in avoiding accidentally closing while casting plus reel wear. A day of crabbing for me is 15 hours of casting a 6 ounce weight every 10 minutes with the hope of reelingnin a couple pounds of crab!
customer_reviews.author: Eugene E. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Bad product!
customer_reviews.text: I did love this reel (BG5000) until it broken! I fished almost every day with this reel in the past month since receiving (August 7th) and it worked amazingly, however, it was broken and there is no reason for this reel broken so soon (only 31 days of using it). It started out with the bail did not flip over or close and then the drag broke... not tighten, just keeps spinning. Such a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Thanh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 4500 and fit 300yds of 30lb spiderwire on it. This thing looks absolutely built like a tank. Noted the 4500+ sizes come with a football riveted handle knob. The sizes are slightly larger than what you're used too. For instance if you wear a XL then order a L if you want to match reel size. Pros: Holds a lot of line Built solid Has bearings similar to those in shimano stella and dogfight The handle screws in which which are better than the hexagonal one It feels well balanced Cons: Heavy weight Conclusion: This is the best reel that can compete against very well against their competitors $200-$250 reels
customer_reviews.author: Koda N.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat daiwas quality at the price point.
customer_reviews.text: The only "damage" was to the factory cardboard box. Took the new reel and some 50lb braid to Port Aransas the following weekend. Brought in 2 bull reds at 36" and 40". The reel performed like a dream. I've been a Penn fan for a very long time but the Daiwa at the price is equal or better to their products.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J.

customer_reviews.title: This is my first Daiwa BG
customer_reviews.text: Love the grip for the handle. The mechanism is butter smooth, it spins on it's on just by gravity. Tested the drag by tightening it and trying to force it by hand and it wouldn't budge with me having to make a big effort. Looks amazingly sexy, can't ask for much more, especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Saulo Ventura

customer_reviews.title: SUPER STRONG AND SUPER SMOOTH
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel because I just got tired of how my old bg90 worked, how I could feel all the gears grinding when I’m reeling my rigs out so I decided to get the new series of the bg because my other older two lasted me and never gave up on me. I go sturgeon in the fall and spring basically at least once a week. I spooled it up with 150lb braid and it’s the smoothest combo I’ve ever held in my hands. TWO THUMBS UP! Diawa always has great products
customer_reviews.author: Tim Filev

customer_reviews.title: Hooked a monster
customer_reviews.text: I used this reel for a day fishing trip off Ponce Inlet and hit some of the artificial reels offshore. I ended up hooking a large grouper or something similar and fought it for a good 30-40 minutes before it broke the line. I don’t know how the lower series would have handled it, but the 8000 series is legit and would easily recommend it to anyone looking for a great reel on the cheap!
customer_reviews.author: TravisinOrlando

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Reel - Put To The Test Day 1 And It Exceeded Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a Penn & Shimano guy but decided to try this Diawa out and man, am I impressed! First day out hooked into a 7 ft nurse shark and this reel didn't flinch. Caught Gag Grouper all day before the shark and it was flawless. I won't hesitate to buy Diawa reels in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Milano

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this reel for a while now and it performs amazingly! The line capacity is great! I've change out the knob for a Gomexus power knob(black and gold) and the reel looks amazing! I definitely recommend this reel to anyone in search or need of an inexpensive saltwater reel. If I could improve anything, it would to increase the drag. Other than that, the reel has been amazing to me and i wish i've discovered it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Y

customer_reviews.title: nice reel but to heavy
customer_reviews.text: as per review on other peoples the reel its not bad but what it kill this reel its the weight extremely heavy daiwa should use lighter material and they will have the perfect reel honesty i use tsunami rod that weight 1 pound i hope i can fish the whole day wit this reel or i will keep using other reel
customer_reviews.author: fed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reels
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of 8000 and being in AZ it was probably a little overboard but I fish from California where I use it on a 12 surf rod and target sharks and rays which so far it has handled effortlessly to Texas with 8ft boat rods for Gar and anything else that will go after big bait . I have no worries what might pick them up they can handle it . and in Az I like to drop lines with huge live bait at the dams and see how big a cat I can get . LOVE THESE REELS . At the price point not sure there is anything better .
customer_reviews.author: rebekah

customer_reviews.title: From halibut to large mouth, no problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1500, the smallest model and it is one of my best spinning reels. I fish it in saltwater as well as in fresh. and have reeled in countless bass, and all kinds of inshore saltwater fish. I paired it with a extra fast Tatula rod. The combo caught a bass on my very first cast. If you don't want to spend over $100 for a spinning reel, consider BG or the Fuego series.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Chen

customer_reviews.title: Best Reels At This Price Point
customer_reviews.text: I have the BG 4000 and 5000. Both reels work perfectly. Smooth Drag, lots of torque with that big main gear and if you have to get something up and in quickly, no problem. Be sure you rinse them down after saltwater use! Good looking reel that works well. The 4000 out fought a 30lb Striper in a heavy current...tough enough. Lubricate the main shaft regularly, or it'll squeak on you.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: 8000 model holds 300yrds of 100lb powerpro Depth Hunter.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth retrieval and super smooth drag. Awesome line capacity. Overall a great buy for $100.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R.

customer_reviews.title: You must buy two or three well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This Daiwa 8000 series 5.3.1 gear ratio 6+1 ball bearing system very smooth strong reliable for the price of this reel i’m robbing them because this reel is worth way more money a must buy people great job daiwa
customer_reviews.author: darrell jackson

customer_reviews.title: Daiwa reels run big.
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME reels! Buy it!! FYI. Daiwa reel sizes run big. Daiwa 5000 size reel body is the same size as my Penn Spinfisher V 6500 and holds 140 yards more! I purchased the Daiwa 5000 cause I love the size of my Penn Battle 2 5000. The Daiwa dwarfs it! I was going to pair it with my 6’6” med/heavy ugly stick But I will be using it on my 10’ surf rod instead. :-)
customer_reviews.author: moises arroyo

customer_reviews.title: A great spining reel for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted for surf fishing, this bad boy hold a lot of line and it is smooth as butter. Can wait to get it in acction, handle feel okay to me as I have big hands, it does not have reverse so you have to be careful with what can get tangle AKA a" finger" Boddy feels solid and few plastic parts, overall great spining reel BG 8000
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Big Game Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 8000 series. This is the largest it its class. A mono line 575m with 0.368 mm dia was completely consumed by spool. Its a bit heavy as expected, if your into big game you would know. Casing is solid with drag adjustment and gear ratio are super smooth. I took away a star because this reel does not have a line lock on the side. RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: The Viquars

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: An incredible reel for the cost. Under 100 for a saltwater reel that is extremely rugged and well made. Bought 3 of these for offshore fishing and catfishing. The 5000 is quite a large reel but surprisingly light in the hand, and extremely smooth. Paired with 2 Ugly Stik Bigwater rods, and an older Rhino rod, and could not be happier. Will update in the future after extended usage. Also bought some ashconfish 70lb, and 35lb braid to test what these reels "like" better.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Mannino

customer_reviews.title: Great reel at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a florida fishing trip and these worked great! Loaded the reel with 65lb braid and the drag worked great for how much work it did. We had fish scream the drag with no issues and it was very consistent. For the price it's hard to beat. My only complaint is there isn't a hook to stow your line on the spool. It's also a heavy reel, but for the size it's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Big and light with the right price.
customer_reviews.text: I still have this reel for backup, but i doubted that ill use this. Its good for the price, only downside is that it has a delay in loosing up the line when your pulling in a fat stingray or shark. So much lighter than my saltist 5000. Big spool with so much line. Good for beginner when starting out fishing. For a decent price reel you wont find it at your local walmart. I would recommend new anglers to start with this for ocean fishing and go from there.
customer_reviews.author: Trung Lai

customer_reviews.title: One out of four BG 5000 defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought four BG5000. Three of them are perfect. Very smooth and well made.However, one of them came with defect. I noticed squeezing and binding while spinning. I have currently open it and investigating the problem. After the opening and removing the AR clutch assembly, the binding and squeaking is gone. Means something is wrong with the AR bearing. I dont know how to fix it bcoz the manual says not to put grease or oil on the AR bearing.
customer_reviews.author: Nauman Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Its a good reel.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in the surf. They are easy to maintain and really smooth. Only issue I have is that sometimes sand can get in the rotor. It is easy to get it out though. I would buy this before I would buy a penn battle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective bail.
customer_reviews.text: Rotation of the handle should close the bail. The bail will rotate approximately 45 degrees rather than 90 degrees. As a result one must manually close the bail to begin line retrieval. There is no way this would have passed even basic quality control testing in the factory. I can only suspect that someone purchased a batch of "Defects" and is now selling them through Amazon. Do not buy this reel on the internet!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stevens

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reel! Been using Penn most of my life. Use and own almost every model both spinners an conventionals but this reel is something else. Just landed a big GT with 30lbs braided line with this reel on a 9ft MH rod. Reels smooth and casts beautifully. I think I'll be using daiwa spinners from now on. Really loving this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Kiawe Wood

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have only had experience with Penn fierce reels before and i will say this reel is 100 times better in every single aspect. Fought a few 15lbs snapper on the 500 so far and the fight was much more smooth / steady and enjoyable. Every angler should have this reel in their arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very nice reel as good a my penn SSV's. Very smooth drag and fighting power.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds way more line than stated !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bg 5000, 4 the manual bail, they say 280 yards of braid, not even close to full , it would hold atleast 500 yards of braid !!! Very smooth & nice drag.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Very good reel for a very good price
customer_reviews.text: Very good reel for a very good price. I consider this reel the best bang for the Money as really ght niw. It is not suppose this be amazing as a $1500 reel but it does an excellent job and has a very good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Salty Tales

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, great line retrieve, it’s been submerged in salt water, laided in the sand and still smooth as the day I got it Best line capacity too
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Best spinning reel Ive owned. Great value. Only issue is the wildly generous line capacity. Id estimate I can put 400 yards of 0.28 mm braid on the 6500. Its stated line capacity is 550 yards of 0.36 mm braid. Bee Ess! Cmon Daiwa, I love your stuff, you dont have to oversell it. Or fire somebody.
customer_reviews.author: Duer

customer_reviews.title: Best reel I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Been salt water fishing in NJ for 8 years. Best reel I have owned. Caught over 30+ fish on it. Im horrible about maintaining however it works flawless. Very happy!.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Thevis

customer_reviews.title: Does not work, bail won't flip over, or close.
customer_reviews.text: I opened up the package, installed the handle and the bail will not flip over, or close. This reel useless, great now I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Spinning Reel
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Daiwa BG spinning reels. These reels are good quality for the money. I am sure you can spend a lot more money for even better reels, but for design/quality, these reels will last you for a long time if you take care of them. I have been fishing for a long time and gone through a lot of reels. These definitely are very good in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kuan Chang

customer_reviews.title: 30% price increase
customer_reviews.text: Reel appears to be solid. Great value for what I originally paid for for it. Since I have purchased cost has went up 30%. Not sure if I would buy again at the current cost .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding reel. Have used on many deep sea trips and set it up on a jigging rod. Great reel for the money. Powerful and durable. It also handled quite a bit of #80 braid. I have caught about a hundred tuna from little 5 pound footballs to 35 pound big eyes, this reel handles without any issues. I don't think you can get a better reel for this price... Maybe not even for twice as much. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aron

customer_reviews.title: Sooo Smooth.  But BIG
customer_reviews.text: This things is LARGE. I bought the 6500 size A lot larger than my Penn 6500 live liner, but also lighter. It is extremely smooth and it looks great! I am proud to walk onto the beach with it. It slings baits very nicely. I recently caught a nice bluefish with it. Just be aware it is nice and big!
customer_reviews.author: Middle Aged Man

customer_reviews.title: What auto bail?
customer_reviews.text: Auto bail doesn’t work, I have less expensive reels that I used for years and they work better than this brand name Daiwa new reel. Fair product, second reel I’m having issues with from Daiwa. Quality control matters Daiwa.
customer_reviews.author: Artur T.

customer_reviews.title: Quality defect
customer_reviews.text: Received my ordered Daiwa BG 8000 like 2 hours ago and immediately went back to UPS to RETURN it due to defect in quality. Called Amazon also. As shown on my pictures. It shows how rough and discolored the half of it. Half is smooth good quality and the half is CRAP. Had scratches on the plastic cover on the corner. Hoping to get the right QUALITY of the protect with the replacement. Gonna update when I receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for a year and it hasn't failed yet. Ive taken this in saltwater and everything. I like it because it holds a good amount of line. Watch running too much mono, you will use a lot of yardage. I ran 250 yards of 80 lb braid and tied an FG not to roughly 50 yards of 80 lb mono mono and everything fit it comfortably on reel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough and very smooth
customer_reviews.text: I burned up a couple Stradics fishing schoolie dolphin years ago. I switched to the older BG reels with zero issues or failures. When these came out, I picked one up at a store and couldn't believe how refined it was compared to the tank like older BG models. I now have 5 of these, no issues to report, and still silky smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, strong, well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent, inexpensive, well made reel. Pros: - well made - solid - smooth - lots of drag - inexpensive - simple Cons: - a bit heavy - bigger than other reels of a similar model number Used to bring in all sorts of ocean fish and it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: It okay
customer_reviews.text: This reel is nice looking but when it comes down to it being seal from splash it is not it had water all in the gear little water and yes i will wash the reel with fresh water to get out salt and sand i had to change the grease as well because it was making a grinding sound and had a feel like a hand mill about 20 minutes of being used the first time .
customer_reviews.author: Omatee Dookie

customer_reviews.title: Solid but HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: These reels seem to be built very solid. Only 2 complaints, the 4500 series are the size of a comparable brand’s 6000/6500 series so they are much larger than I expected. Also holy crap are they heavy! Which could be a positive or negative. At least you can tell they are built solid.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Broke after using 4 times
customer_reviews.text: Used it 4 times and something inside broke. Now it doesn't work. Of course the return window has passed by 1 week. I wasted $100. Very upset!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhula

customer_reviews.title: Quality and performance equals great value!
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth retrieve; strong, smooth, and consistent drag; quality build; and, something that could be very important, a slender depth reel foot. This reel foot fits into a rod reel seat that the Penn I initially purchased would not. I returned the Penn and bought the BG, and am much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Embry

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel at this price point!!
customer_reviews.text: This reel is smooth and feels good in your hand. It is a bit heavy but the take up and large gear make up for that as it’s proven to be really durable. Makes big fish feel small. Depending on how you like the fight, that’s either good or bad. Muscling large fish off the rocks means it’s a good thing for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A Collins

customer_reviews.title: Daiwa Black Gold (BG) Spinning Reel
customer_reviews.text: I guess i missed the explanation on how large, Heavy the Reel is. Maybe I can use it on a pier?? Value ? Durability maybe ?
customer_reviews.author: Lee T Watrin

customer_reviews.title: This Real is very smooth for the price. As good as some of my expensive stuff
customer_reviews.text: It handles heavier line for bottom fishing. I have it on a jigging rod with 80# braid for bottom fishing. 80 - 120 ft is where most of my bottom fishing. Just of NC cost on the wrecks. Love it. Great strength, line retrieval is also good.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in NC

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite reel.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the hype, I decided to purchase this reel in the 6500. The reel is heavy and does not cast as well as my penn battle 2. It also makes a strange grinding noise while in use. All in all, I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: philip j champion

customer_reviews.title: Solid good shark reel
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for me offshore fishing. I do recommend spacing the spool up some as my braid didn’t spool evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: No. Really. Buy these. Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: I do not believe there is a better spinning reel for less than $400. Period. I have them from 2500 to 6500 on various setups for cats bass and carp. Wife has a pair of 4500 with 50lb braid for the big kitties. Smooth. Reliable. Best drag I have encountered on a spinning reel. Smooth no nonsense. Perhaps the best value in spinning reels.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Watson

customer_reviews.title: Love the reel
customer_reviews.text: If you compare to others you will see that you can't beat this reel. Once you hold it and see how it works you will agree that its one of the best reels. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: going to be a great real this spring when the black drum and striper ...
customer_reviews.text: light weight and very smooth operating. going to be a great real this spring when the black drum and striper run. its light enough to cast lures with, in my opinion, will see if that is correct soon with some musky fishing. first daiwa reel I have bought in over 20 years and look foreword to trying this one out.
customer_reviews.author: TomWV

customer_reviews.title: I've only used this baby twice... IN ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this baby twice... IN THE LAST HOUR!! This reel is slick and smooth. I reeled in a 15-20lb bush with no problem at all!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: No good for surf fishing
customer_reviews.text: Do not use this reel for surf fishing. My rig fell into the sand once on the first use and the reel stopped working completely. I rinsed it our really well but it still doesn't work. It was a total waste of money and not a durable reel.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Very sad and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This reel was fine for about a month and it started acting up. The line is only filling up the reel at the top of the reel spool. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: maloney b. alfons

customer_reviews.title: Use 50 + lb braid
customer_reviews.text: Great real, handled 4 foot hammerhead no problem, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Rich S.

customer_reviews.title: Felt very solid and firm.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this thing. When I saw it on the computer i thought that it might just be another fishing reel, but once i got it and took it out to try it man... it felt like it is well built it's smooth and sturdy. i know i got my monies worth.
customer_reviews.author: Ly Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Freakin love this reel
customer_reviews.text: Freakin love this reel! It's a beast. Butter smooth. Best spinning reel for the price! If ya haven't purchase one yet then what are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.author: The King

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for someone looking for a tough, good price range!!! It will your money 💰!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of Shimano. Long cast for striper and hybrid bass. First time using BG. Look like it well built. A little heavy but lighter than PENN. It'll take beating for sure. Just perfect 👌 for a type of fishing 🎣 i do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: One could argue that I've got too many reels. I would disagree with that person. These BG's are just plainly the best reel for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Hombre

customer_reviews.title: Big Win Reel
customer_reviews.text: My lives this reel. I like it too it’s so light weight and easy to bring the fish in. I plan to buy me one. You still have to get the pole.
customer_reviews.author: jaustin012

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Fishing ⭐️
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend love fishing and it’s perfect gift for him. It’s really long thats why I didn’t take a picture but everything’s are same on the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Dhez

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding reel.
customer_reviews.text: Diawa did it right. Great reel and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ream

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel (not just for the money)
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent reel. It outperforms some of my lower and midlevel Penns. Great feel and excellent tolerances on the build. It is a stout, durable reel that is working very well in saltwater. So far, nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think anyone can beat these reels for the price. These reels are smooth and strong. I currently own two of them. 4500 and 5000. Use them for bottom fishing and they work flawlessly. If you don't own one, buy one!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very nice reel
customer_reviews.text: Very nice reel its going to replace my old shimano bait runner 6500
customer_reviews.author: BigGonzo

customer_reviews.title: Smooth reel only small flaw
customer_reviews.text: Love how smooth this reel is. I don't like the fact that you have to flip the bell over manually instead of turning the handle
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid reel
customer_reviews.text: Relatively light weight, yet solid feel considering the price point. Fast retrieve when reeling in line. Will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IF you looking for Valie for your money this is it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a upcoming trip to OBX NC for surf fishing also purchased a 12' rod for this reel. Fro. Initial inspection seames to be on par with some other well known brands for about half the price. Will update revoew after use it I n vacation
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased 4 of these already!
customer_reviews.text: These reel are really awesome and very well made and work as well as reels costing 2 times the price!
customer_reviews.author: BK Broiler

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth, no problems so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good have used it about 10 times with my st. Croci 12 surf rod, very smooth no problems
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Money's worth
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat this reel for what it is priced and its durability. I live in Hawaii and been using it every weekend for the last month and no issues at all , just rinse with dawn soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: The "reel" deal!
customer_reviews.text: Love these reels! Great for offshore pulling fish off the bottom or those smoker Kings!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: item as promised
customer_reviews.text: The reel is nice and tight. Shipping was good and the box was double packed so came perfect. Didn't fish the reel yet but i seems like it's gonna be good. real smooth out of the box and the drag seems real strong. When i barely dial it gets tight and will lock down easy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Kim

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 reel
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Penn Fierce 6000 with the 5000BG. I spooled both with 50lb braid and the BG held 30 yards more. The Fierce is a good reel, but for about an extra $20 the BG adds so many more features such as a larger main gear, larger spool, and 3 more bearings that are higher quality as well. Although the one thing I do miss about the Penn reel is the louder drag clicker and bail arm, but that's just my preference.
customer_reviews.author: Joey J Mei

customer_reviews.title: I really like it, I took it up up the Sierras ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, I took it up up the Sierras float tube fishing & two of the fish were really nice drag pulling fish. Super smooth drag that I had confidence with. I came home and sold two of my reels and ordered another BG1500, I can't wait for next season!
customer_reviews.author: Dale D

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really wish it had reverse gear. I get that this will weaken the design but be brave and build it in!
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Daiwa BG
customer_reviews.text: My favorite saltwater reels. I have three in different sizes. They last for years with proper maintenance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daiwa BG 8000 reel is built for salt water fishing
customer_reviews.text: Have used for surf fishing for over a month now. The reel was well built, quiet and sealed for salt water fishing. Dropped it in the sand salt water twice already, a little bit of WD40 can restore the reel in brand new condition. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just received my BG 1500 in the mail. Have not used it yet, but feels really smooth and like the build quality. Can't wait to try it out opening day for trout.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Reel not sealed -
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed had for less than summer to fish beach saltwater messed up gears and Diawa won’t replace at this time. If ur looking for surf water reel for with Tsunami which is fully sealed. Just my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, big & expensive
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels great, little bit on a big side but very well built. In my opinion this reel is too expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Matemk

customer_reviews.title: Big and heavy like a tank
customer_reviews.text: Big and heavy like a tank. Built for big fish no doubt. I had a big sturgeon on and the reel handled flawlessly. The drag system did its job. Nice reel!
customer_reviews.author: Mao Van

customer_reviews.title: Smooth like butter...
customer_reviews.text: So smooth... I'm so impressed! Daiwa for life now! Excellent Craftsmanship!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie r Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Bail doesn’t flip back.
customer_reviews.text: The bail doesn’t flip over. Was a Father’s Day gift and finally got a pole to put it on. Went fishing this and the nail won’t flip and the return window is closed. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, fast retrieve, but no line holder on reel.
customer_reviews.text: Used twice. Fast retrieve. Minus 1-star because does not have the line holder on the reel. hope to get many years out of it. Very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Questioneer

product_meta.title: Daiwa Bg Spinning Reel
product_meta.description:
The Daiwa BG Spinning Reel sports high-quality components and industry-leading ingenuity, making this one lean, mean, fish-fighting machine. The BG is equipped with a "Hard Bodyz" machined aluminum body and side cover for strength and internal part stability. To increase the strength in the form of corrosion and scratch resistance, Daiwa has Black Anodized the body and body cover.

Air Rotor weighs 15% less than ordinary rotors, because its unique shape cuts out the fat while distributing stress more evenly for maximum strength in a lightweight design. The ABS spool's maximized core diameter and reversed taper means no dead line buried deep in the core, and it causes less casting friction for longer and easier casting. It's also braid-ready. Daiwa's machined aluminum Screw-in-Handle design provides zero movement or play between the main gear and handle arm, offering the angler both confidence and control when rotating the handle.

Inside, the BG features a seven-bearing drive system that consists of six ball bearings and a single roller bearing. Infinite Anti-Reverse can be found in 4000 model reels or smaller, while Infinite Dual Anti-Reverse is in 4500 models and larger. The Carbon ATD (Automatic Tournament Drag) is waterproof and allows for super-smooth performance. The oversized Digigear System increases gear-tooth contact points and provides smoother, extended gear life and more power with increased torque. 4500 models are larger also feature a manual return bail.

BG2000 Reel
• Gear ratio: 5.6:1; LPT: 29.5"; reel weight: 8.5 oz.; max drag: 4.4 lbs.

BG2500 Reel
• Gear ratio: 5.6:1; LPT: 33.2"; reel weight: 9.3 oz.; max drag: 13.2 lbs.

BG3000 Reel
• Gear ratio: 5.6:1; LPT: 37.4"; reel weight: 10.8 oz.; max drag: 15.4 lbs.

BG3500 Reel
• Gear ratio: 5.7:1; LPT: 38.5"; reel weight: 14.1 oz.; max drag: 17.6
feature_bullets: Black Anodized Machined Aluminum Housing ("Hard Bodyz" Body & Side Cover), Over-sized Digigear (Digigear System)
Solid Screw-In Handle, Air Rotor, Dynamic Cut Aluminum ABS Spool
Braided Line Ready Spool, Waterproof Drag System, Carbon ATD, Line Per Handle Turn: 43.1"
Manual Return Bail (4500 and Larger), 6BB+1RB, Gear Ratio: 5.6:1, Drag Max:22
Infinite Anti-Reverse System (4000 and Smaller), Infinite Dual Anti-Reverse System (4500 and Larger)
